name: Time Travel Quiz | TV & Movies Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text: The TV series "Twilight Zone" had countless episodes dealing with time travel. One of the best involved a commercial airplane that went back to prehistoric times. What happened to the plane?
questions.correct: It left the prehistoric world, but didn't make it completely back to its own time period
options: It returned to its own time period and went into the future
It was forced to remain in the prehistoric world
questions.explanation:
It left the prehistoric world, but didn't make it completely back to its own time period.

	It departed in the present and went back into prehistoric times. Its attempted return fell short: it ended up in 1939.

questions.text: "A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthur's Court" is Mark Twain's tale of a man who goes back in time. What event (which he uses to his advantage) occurs while he is there?
questions.explanation:
Eclipse.

	Bing Crosby, Rhonda Fleming and William Bendix in the movie version."I will blot out the sun ..."

questions.text: "Time Tunnel" was a TV series that featured time travel on a regular basis. Who was one of the time travelers?
questions.explanation:
James Darren.

	Lee Meriwether was also in the cast.

questions.text: "The Final Countdown" involved a trip into the past for Kirk Douglas. Who else was in the cast?
questions.explanation:
Katharine Ross.

	This trip went back to the time of the bombing of Pearl Harbor.

questions.text: "Back to the Future" was a more recent "time travel" movie. What type of car was involved in the trip?
questions.explanation:
DeLorean.

	Michael J. Fox and Christopher Lloyd.

questions.text: "The Time Machine" is the classic story of time travel. How does the protagonist (in the movie) rescue Weena?
questions.correct: She is being swept away in a river
options: She is about to fall from a great height
She is trapped in a fire
questions.explanation:
She is being swept away in a river.

	Rod Taylor rescues Yvette Mimieux from a raging river - as others sit by in complete indifference. Also, with Alan Young and Sebastian Cabot. Entertaining.

questions.text: In "Star Trek", several of the members of the Enterprise go back in time to the Depression. Ultimately, it is determined that the Joan Collins character must die. Why?
questions.correct: Otherwise, she will champion a peace movement at the wrong time
options: Otheriwse, she will become the carrier of a deadly disease
Otherwise, she will become the mother of an infamous military leader
Otherwise, she will influence her future husband to make war
questions.explanation:
Otherwise, she will champion a peace movement at the wrong time.

	She champions a peace movement that delays the entry of the U.S. into WW II. Thus, Germany wins the war by developing the A-bomb first. Great episode.

questions.text: In "Peabody's Improbable History" (from the "Rocky and Bullwinkle" TV series), Peabody (a dog) travels back in time. Who is his companion on these trips?
questions.explanation:
Sherman.

	"Wayback" was the name of the machine that Peabody used for his trips.

questions.text: "Somewhere in Time" featured Christopher Reeve as a time traveler. What type of work did his character do?
questions.explanation:
Writer.

	A playwright. Interesting story. (Beware of recent coins ...)

questions.text: Starting and ending with "Twilight Zone": some robbers steal gold and attempt to enter a state of suspended animation (in order to avoid escape and enjoy the money in the future). What goes wrong?
questions.correct: Gold is not valuable when they awaken in the future
options: The police have also gone into the future via suspended animation
They are unable to awaken and remain forever asleep
They die in the attempt to enter the future
questions.explanation:
Gold is not valuable when they awaken in the future.

	They steal it, escape, and make it safely into the future. The irony, however, is that the gold is no longer of great value.
